indications: quinine sulfate capsule usp cinchona alkaloid indicated treatment uncomplicated plasmodium falciparum malaria ( 1 ) .
contraindications: adults ( ≥ 16 years age ) : 648 mg ( two capsules ) every 8 hours 7 days ( 2.1 ) . patients severe chronic renal impairment : one loading dose 648 mg ( two capsules ) followed 12 hours later 324 mg ( one capsule ) every 12 hours 7 days ( 2.2 ) .
adverseReactions: quinine sulfate contraindicated patients following : prolongation qt interval ( 4 ) glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase ( g6pd ) deficiency ( 4 ) myasthenia gravis ( 4 ) known hypersensitivity quinine , mefloquine , quinidine ( 4 ) optic neuritis ( 4 )
name: QUININE SULFATE
indications_original: Quinine sulfate capsule USP is a cinchona alkaloid indicated for treatment of uncomplicated Plasmodium falciparum malaria ( 1 ).
contraindications_original: Adults (≥ 16 years of age): 648 mg (two capsules) every 8 hours for 7 days ( 2.1 ). Patients with severe chronic renal impairment: one loading dose of 648 mg (two capsules) followed 12 hours later by 324 mg (one capsule) every 12 hours for 7 days ( 2.2 ).
adverseReactions_original: Quinine sulfate is contraindicated in patients with the following: Prolongation of QT interval ( 4 ) Glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency ( 4 ) Myasthenia gravis ( 4 ) Known hypersensitivity to quinine, mefloquine, or quinidine ( 4 ) Optic neuritis ( 4 )
